Christendom is all on wrong lines, it is really an endeavour to divert God from Christ, but God will not be diverted from Christ. That is the spiritual signification of mount Zion, it is the spot upon which God will act, and when you have reached that spot in your soul you will discover the wisdom of it. Everything God does He does in wisdom; wisdom is the handmaid of love, and therefore wisdom does everything perfectly; yon cannot add to it. Now, as I have said, mount Zion is spiritually Christ risen. In Him God sets forth His sovereign right to bless. Think of that! Is it not well worth your while to submit to the sovereign rights of God, when you see that His sovereign rights signify that He is going to bless you. Read Psalm 132see the blessing that comes in there: "I will satisfy her poor with bread. I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy"; and then in Psalm 133also, "there the Lord commanded the blessing, even life for evermore".
Then we find in verse seven, "He will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the veil that is spread over all nations". Darkness prevails everywhere; Christendom is dark; it has more light than heathendom, but it is dark in regard to God. The "veil" is there. Why is that? It is because they do not recognise God's rights. Why are souls dark? I believe the explanation of it is that they do not recognise the sovereign rights of God in Christ risen. Christ risen is God's centre, and if you refuse to recognise that, you are dark, and you remain dark; but directly you recognise it in its true light, everything is adjusted for you, you apprehend God, and you apprehend everything in relation to God; the veil is gone!
Christians are the only people who have a right
[Page 513]
judgment about things; the simplest believer may have a clear judgment, and why? Because he recognises Christ risen. Is your heart dark in regard to God? Soul troubles are prevalent; the secret is that men do not submit to the rights of God; the will is active in some way or another; you are not submitting yourself to God. Submitting yourself to God is that you recognise Christ, and that involves the entire denial of yourself. If you are dark in your soul, it is just because the will is active; you are in your soul disputing the rights of God in Christ risen, and directly you submit to them it is wonderful what light you will receive. Look at Saul of Tarsus; see how he was illuminated; he was persistently refusing God's rights, but directly he is brought down to submit to them, what wonderful light he received into his soul! I do beg of you, if you have soul difficulties, to go to God about them. I do not say that you do not need teaching and instruction, but if you go to God, your soul will be settled, you will have no longer any difficulties in regard to Him.
There is another thing. He swallows up death in victory. Where has He done that? He has done it in Christ risen, and in the future it will be done geographically in Zion. I have no doubt that God will revert to that mountain, and everything will radiate from that. It is there that He swallows up death in victory. Now see what gain there is in recognising the rights of God. You get a feast, and the veil is removed, and death is removed from your spirit. Christians are marked by these things, they are satisfied with food from God; they are not in darkness, the veil is removed from their hearts, and then death is removed from their spirits. If you are a believer in Christ you are not afraid to die; faith sees that death is swallowed up in victory. "I will swallow up death in victory", says Jehovah; we anticipate that, as the apostle says in writing to
[Page 514]
the Corinthians. "Thanks be to God which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ". We do not wait for it, we have it on the principle of faith. God has broken up death, He has swallowed up death in victory in the resurrection of Christ, and you come into the good of that as you recognise God's rights in Christ risen.
Then He says one thing more, "The Lord God will wipe away tears from off all faces, and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from all the earth". Now, these are things that are not far away from you; these things are all realised on the principle of faith now by the believer; you have abundance in the way of spiritual food; you have light, the veil is removed from your heart; death is removed from your spirit, and tears are removed from your face: that is what God does for you, He wipes away tears from off all faces, God Himself does that. We know that we are in the wilderness, in a world of sorrow, but in the wilderness the tears are wiped away from all faces. God brings us into that now, we come into it now in Christ risen. May the Lord grant that we may each enter into it.
I have great exercise as to the character of our superficial Christianity; we are very superficial. God looks for soul exercise; His end is to bring us into the reality of these things that we may be superior to everything here, even to the tears and sorrows. God grant that our souls may be in the possession of all this.
